THE OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY
TELECOMMUNICATIONS CENTER
2470 NORTH STAR ROAD
COLUMBUS 21, OHIO
Richard B. Hull, Executive Director
August 20, 1962
Mr. William G. Harley
President, NAEB
1346 Connecticut Ave., N.W.
Washington 6, D.C.
Dear Bill:
I note the Educational Media Council has its next meeting scheduled for
the Washington area on October 10, 11, 12. This conflicts with a local
event called by the State Department of Public Instruction on adult edu¬
cation and the Ohio State ETV Network plan.
My record of attending EMC sessions is very bad, and frankly ! feel guilty
about it. If you for some reason believe l should remain on EMC as an
NAEB representative with Harold Hill or someone attending in my absence,
okay. Unless, however, there is some compelling reason it would probably
be more fair to put a guy on the EMC who could make the meetings regular¬
ly and contribute more than I*ve been able to do. Best.
Sincerely
R
P.S. The HEW-NAEB meeting on the 15th of August was first-rate l thought.
Kessler was extremely pleased. In amy event he met realism ahead of
time in the case of at least two operators.
